subject: RE: [junit] debuggers
msgSnippet: Allow me to suggest: 1. Write Unit test: FooTest.java 2. Write Foo.java 3. Read error message 4. Think 5. Think some more 6. Refactor the object to make it
messageBody:
Allow me to suggest:

1. Write Unit test: FooTest.java
2. Write Foo.java
3. Read error message
4. Think
5. Think some more
6. Refactor the object to make it easier to test.
7. Yet more thinking.
8. Can't remember getting here since discovering unit testing! :-)

Simon

-----------------------------------------------------------------
Simon P. Chappell simon.chappell@...
Java Programming Specialist www.landsend.com
Lands' End, Inc. (608) 935-4526


>-----Original Message-----
>From: steven.hale@... [mailto:steven.hale@...]
>Sent: Thursday, March 13, 2003 1:13 AM
>To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: Re: [junit] debuggers
>
>
>
>My debugging habits are usually something like this:
>
>1. Read the error message (if there is one)
>2. Think
>3. Read the log
>4. Think
>5. Write a unit test
>6. Launch the debugger
>
>Since adopting junit (2 -3 years ago) I can honestly say I've
>not yet been
>forced down to level 6! I try to encourage programmers in my
>team not to
>start at 6 first.
>
>Judging by the varied responses there's clearly a whole range of other
>successful strategies - maybe it's related to the type of
>application being
>programmed.
>
>Steven
>
>
>
>
>
